Speaker: Nathan
Text: Oh come on. You call this white water? Don't you remember the Pango rapids?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh, I remember. There was a little gal in Pradesh province who uh…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Enough! Paddle. We're not making much headway! Faster! Faster!

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah, that's what she said!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Sully!

Speaker: Sully
Text: Look… I’m going as last as I can!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah, that's what you told her!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Whew! Now that was a workout.

Speaker: Sully
Text: No, no. That's what she said.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Really? I mean, really?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Hey, Nate? I, uh, I didn’t want to say anything, but how come we’re suddenly going down river?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: What the hell is this? Where are we?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Oh crap… Sully, I had the map upside down. Paddle backwards… Paddle backwards, now!

Speaker: Sully
Text: What? What the matter? Ok, ok… holy shit!
[He sees a waterfall.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Sully?

Speaker: Sully
Text: All right back, back, back! Goddamn… it… get up here! Jeezus Nate… are you trying to kill us?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Sorry Sully… it’s not like I’ve ever done that before.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh really? I guess we forgot that little fiasco down in Angkor Borei…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Hey, I did not have the map upside down that time…

Speaker: Sully
Text: Right.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Just had the wrong map.

Speaker: Sully
Text: You ready?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah.
[They continue paddling.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Oh, why do yo always bring up Angkor Borei? I mean seriously?

Speaker: Sully
Text: What are you talking about?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: You never let anything go.

Speaker: Sully
Text: That is not true at all. But you do know what that Khmer statue was worth?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. A lot, I know. How could I forget? Especially with you around.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Quiet, Nate. Guerro's men are crawling all over the place. You keep rowing while I take care of these guys. And keep the boat steady so I can aim.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: What are you going to shoot 'em with? Tobacco spit?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Remember I said we couldn't afford a motor? This little baby is why… (He takes out a hand grenade launcher.]

Speaker: Sully
Text: Nailed him! That bastard's dead! These guys are like clay targets!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: There… in the trees! Taking fire!

Speaker: Sully
Text: These the ruins we’re looking for?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: They must be. Aqueducts… yeah.

Speaker: Sully
Text: I thought only the Romans built this stuff?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Evidently the Quivirans did too… the aqueducts were one of the reasons that Marcos thought he was on the trail of the Spanish Bishops. Uh, Sully?
[The canoe’s leaking.]

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh shit. C’mon… we gotta get this tub to shore before it sinks and we’re fish food.
[They get out on the beach. Canoe sinks.]

Speaker: Sully
Text: Shit. And there goes the fist of our gear.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Dammit Sully. I told you to wear your pack…

Speaker: Sully
Text: I know… I know. I should have listened. .

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Alright, well… we’re here, and in one piece. Let’s find a way across this river.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Holy shit, it’s a regular lncan highway…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Quiviran, Sully… the Incas were in Peru… and a couple of centuries later.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Just testin’ ya, kid.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Right. So how’d I do?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Not bad. Couldn’t-a said it better myself.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Nope. No you couldn't-have.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Looks safe enough.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Whoah… careful… the mist from the waterfall… slippery as hell.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Huh. That's great.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Alright. I think if we follow these ruins it should lead us right to the temple complex.

Speaker: Sully
Text: You sure you got the map right-side-up this time?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Hey, that could have happened to anyone.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah, it could have. So stop giving me shit about the damn GPS

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Deal.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Back!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Guerro’s men.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah, that is not good.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: No, no, actually it is. They’re a long way from the Temple of the Serpents… you were right. Chase is buying some time.

Speaker: Chapter 22
Text: “Chew the Hide Off a Rhino”

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Snake temple, or something. Just keep your eyes open.
[After the fight.]

Speaker: Sully
Text: I tell you what, having Guerro’s thugs shooting at you is still a million times better than rowing around on that goddamn flimsy death trap.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Hey, you bought the canoe.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah well, sometimes I'm more cheap than smart.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: That's really cheap. Oph! Get down!

Speaker: Sully
Text: That is a goddamn 50 caliber. That’ll chew the hide off a rhino.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Any ideas?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Well he’s shielded from the front. I’ll distract him, you try and flank him.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: That work back in the day?

Speaker: Sully
Text: You see any chew marks?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Just the rhino. Alright, here we go.

Speaker: Sully
Text: We can’t hit that turret from down here! Help me clear these guys out! You’re all clear! Find a way to climb up and flank that bastard!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Alright, Sully. Watch yourself. Ok? Alright, Sully, here I go.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Hey boys, here! Yo, hey!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Ooof. Jesus.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Hey! Over here! Holy shit!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Ooof. Crap.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yo! Hey! YOU! Whoa!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Jesus.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Hey boys, here!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Ah crap!

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yoo hoo! Hey guys!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I'm almost there. You just hang in there. All clear.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Nice work kid. Wait for me there. I’ll be right up… and in half the time.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah, well it’s easy when nobody’s shooting at you.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Nah, nah, the bullets keep you movin’…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah? Well time to prove it. C’mon! Move!
[Here comes the reinforcement…]

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh, Christ!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: C’mon sully. Go!

Speaker: Sully
Text: I'm making a break for it! Cover me! Dammit, clear them out.
[After the fight.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I think those cigars of yours are starting to slow you down.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Not by a long shot… Lungs of leather.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Well, good! Then you won’t mind a little more climbing. After you.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Son of a bitch. That’s a tall one.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Nothing we can’t handle. C’mon, I’ll give you a boost.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Up, Nate! Up! C'mon.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Consuela ever complain about you crushing her?!

Speaker: Sully
Text: You can’t crush a spinner… Now grab my hand. That was nothing… Oh! You see the size of that mosquito? It was like a rat with wings. You ever wonder if rats were really just mosquitos without wings?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: No, not really. That's absolutely ridiculous. Y'know, I forgot how philosophical you become when you’re thirsty.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Why did I come down here again.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Doing all right?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah. Yeah. Just great. Dammit… I'm getting dizzy in this fun house.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Claustrophobic much?

Speaker: Sully
Text: If start screaming, just slap me.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I'll be glad to get the hell out of here.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Not soon enough for me. We're going where? Shit. Uh, damn it. Dead end.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Not when you’ve got a pair of these. (he shows Sully his hands.]

Speaker: Sully
Text: I don’t know kid. You’ve seen how unstable this shit is. It’s like trying to climb shale.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Come on. It’s been here for a few thousand years. It’ll last a few more minutes. Fine. I’ll go first.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Hey, what’s wrong? Not as sturdy as you thought, eh? Oh no! Get off that thing! Now! Nate?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah, yeah. I'm OK.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Well, I’m waiting…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Fine. You were right. The ruins are uh, a little unstable.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Thank you. Hey, and look. No more dead end. Had for that temple mound. We’ll meet up there.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Alright. Hey uh, you know I could have done this on purpose, y’know? Giving you a nice clear trail to follow?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Whatever you say.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh man… there’s no way we’re getting across here.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: The river must have cut a channel all the way to the mountains. Sully, look out!
[Some Guerro’s men joins the party.]

Speaker: Sully
Text: I see ‘em. A little help? Somebody wanna tell me what the hell is takin' so long? Nate!? Hello! Nice work, kid! Even if it did take forever. Nate! I’m pinned down over here.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I'm on it! Hang in there!

Speaker: Sully
Text: I’m trying! Hey, I could use a little help!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Just keep your head down… I’m trying Sully!

Speaker: Sully
Text: Mind helping me take a few of these guys out?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I thought you wanted ‘em all to yourself!
[Nate manages to help Sully.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: You ok?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh yeah. Never better. Nate, I can't get across, and I’m too high up t climb down. Come and lower this damn bridge for me.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah, right. How am I gonna… Oh hello! Hang on, Sully! I got a plan.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Now go cut that rope loose, so I can get off this goddamned thing.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Now that’s what she said.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Just lower the goddamn bridge, will ya?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: All set!

Speaker: Sully
Text: Thanks, kid! See you on the other side…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Shit. More of Guerro’s men… a lot of Guerro’s men. This sucks! Oh sure. Snipers, too?! Bring it on!
[After the fight.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Sully?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah, right here. Get down!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Another 50 caliber?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Guerro sure does have a penchant for those damn things.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah… there must have been a sale at the army surplus.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Well, you’re on your own this time kid… I don’t have shit for cover over here.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Alright, well… just stay there, I'll figure something.

Speaker: Sully
Text: This turret's too high! I'm pinned down! How about those ruins heading up the canyon? Maybe you can get behind him from there!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Good idea!

Speaker: Sully
Text: How’s it going, kid? You got a vantage point on that sucker yet?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I’m working on it!

Speaker: Sully
Text: Take out that turret, Nate!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Steady… move slowly… be careful…

Speaker: Sully
Text: Nate, what the hell are you doing? What's taking you so long? Just flank him and shoot!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: There you are, you son of a bitch.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Nice job. So how many more of those you figure el Generale's got in his back pocket?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: A few dozen, if I had to guess.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Well, those aren’t just light patrols. We gotta getting close to his camp.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah… Alright, let’s go. There must be a place we can cross the chasm up ahead.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Right. Well, see you on the other side.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: …you said that once.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah? Well I’ll say it as many damn times as I want. C'mon, let’s go. Hey, Nate, just up ahead there’s a bridge that crosses the chasm. Find a way to get to it. I’ll meet you on the…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: …on the other side. Got it. Yeah… that's a long way down.

Speaker: Sully
Text: You know how I love heights.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: What are you doing up there?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Hanging on for dear life, mostly! It's a nice view though.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Woah, crap!

Speaker: Sully
Text: You alright?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: This way. Come on.
[They find an entrance to a temple decorated with two statues of a snake.]

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh, La Selva de las Serpientes. ‘The Serpent Jungle’.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: This must be one of the outposts of the temple complex. We’re getting close.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah… wait a second… you hear that?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: What?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Sounds like choppers…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Lemme know when you hear ’Ride of the Valkyries’… then I’ll worry.

Speaker: Sully
Text: No, no, goddamnit… I’m serious. Listen.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: What? Oh yeah, yeah… I hear ’em.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Guerro must be bringing in more men. You suppose he found the Serpent temple?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: If he did, Chase is in trouble. They came from that way. We gotta move.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: We dig in. They can’t hit us down here.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Don't stay in one spot too long! If you have to move, zig and zag! And then zig and zag again.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Oh shit, Snipers! Keep your head down.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Stay close, Nate! More snipers! Bastards have us sighted! That's the last of ‘em! C'mon, we can climb up here! Nate, c'mere. Give me a boost.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Ok.

Speaker: Sully
Text: C'mon, put your back into it.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: You should try it from my end!

Speaker: Sully
Text: …here. Grab my hand. Now, was that so hard?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yes it was. C'mon. Let’s get to the top of this thing so we can see where we are.

Speaker: Sully
Text: I’m followin' you. Oh! Jesus.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: What's wrong?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Just a little dizzy….

Speaker: Nathan
Text: You alright?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah. I’ll be alright in a second. This damn thin air. Oh nice.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah… that’s a long way down.

Speaker: Sully
Text: You know how I love heights.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Just don't look down.

Speaker: Sully
Text: I'm tryin' not to.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: That's the trick.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh! I looked down.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh yeah.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I can see my house from here.

Speaker: Sully
Text: It's a nice view though.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Whoah.

Speaker: Sully
Text: You alright?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah, I'm ok. It's just… not as much fun as it usually is. Alright… not too much further.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Good.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Hey.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Hey, hey! Hold it up kid.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: What? What are you doing? There’s light up ahead. Don’t rest now.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Jesus… I am not resting. I got a headache from this damn thin air up here.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Oh, maybe I should gather some fronds and make you a nice comfy bed, huh?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh, would you mind?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: In your dreams princess. Come on, let’s go.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Ah swell. More patrols.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Nah, this is good. They have no idea we’re here. Take them out quietly.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Uh oh! He’s got a shotgun!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Alright. That's the last one, I think.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Ho, ho, ho… man. Now that is a view.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Wow. Hey, that’s gotta be it… the Temple of the Serpents.

Speaker: Sully
Text: What the hell is that?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: It’s gunfire.

Speaker: Sully
Text: I know it’s gunfire… but who’s shootin’ at who?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I don’t know… whoah… that’s not good.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Nate get down…
[A chopper flying above their heads.]

Speaker: Sully
Text: Well here's the choppers we heard. YH-1 Cherokees… transport. But something’s not adding up here, Nate.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: What do you mean.

Speaker: Sully
Text: I mean that Guerro doesn’t have anything like that in his fleet…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Oh crap… Dante…

Speaker: Sully
Text: Wait a minute… I thought you said Dante wasn’t in this thing anymore.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: He isn’t… or he wasn’t…

Speaker: Sully
Text: Then?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: He may have mentioned something about hiring an army…

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh God… that’s just great.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I thought he was kidding.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh Christ, Nate. Have you ever known Dante to kid about anything where money is involved? Anything else you forgot to tell me?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I’m sorry. All right? I should have told you. Oh man, we gotta move. Chase’s in the middle down there. Get back!
[Some mercenaries comes to the top of the temple.]

Speaker: Sully
Text: Let’s just, uh… cover our own asses right now? We sure as hell won’t be much use to her dead.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Good point.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: They’re near the top. Find them!

Speaker: Sully
Text: Stay with me! This way, kid!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Sully? I don't see a way down on this side. We'll have to go back the way we came up.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Hold on. Not so fast.
[He brings a rope.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Where did you get that?

Speaker: Sully
Text: One of Guerro‘s men. He won't be needing it. Let me tie this off. Here goes nothing! This is way better than climbing tip! C'mon! Try and keep up, will ya!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Just remember five minutes ago you were the one who needed oxygen. Look! Up there! More Guerro’s men.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Son of a bitch. These guys just won’t give up.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Get moving, Sully!

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: They’re going down the side… stop them!

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: The second temple site is under attack. Radio Guerro!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Sully, get moving!

Speaker: Sully
Text: Take him out first!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Jesus, Sully. You flying to get us killed?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Just keep those guys from cutting our ropes!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Where’ve I heard that before? Oh yeah… from a girl…

Speaker: Sully
Text: We’re getting close! I can see ruins below. On your left! We’re sitting ducks, Nate! We're almost there, kid! Try and keep up!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Last rope, I swear! Nate! He’s cuttin’ the rope! I’m out of ammo…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Oh, crap!
[They fall.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Thanks for breaking my fall.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Don’t mention it. What’d I tell ya?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: You told me?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh God, I’ve seen fire escapes in Hong Kong more stable than this damn thing…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah? Well give them another thousand years, then we’ll see… alright… c’mon.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Hey, those aren't Guerro's men.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: No. Dante's mercenaries. Professional killers.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah, well you and me? We’re professional survivors. They got nothing on us. I'll wait here while you do your thing.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Oh, shit, I'm gonna need some help down here!

Speaker: Sully
Text: On my way! One down, only a complete army to go. Let’s get the hell out of here. I want to be long gone by the time reinforcements arrive… Oh shit! Reinforcements! That's the last of ‘em… for now. C'mon, let’s move.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: What’ya think?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Piece of cake.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Really?

Speaker: Sully
Text: No. But what the hell. We’ve seen worse.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Ok, ok, here goes nothing.
[He makes the jump… barely.]

Speaker: Sully
Text: There, see? What’d I tell ya? Now back up.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Hold on Sully… that was too close.

Speaker: Sully
Text: No, no, C’mon, what’re you talking about? Just move back a little.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Hey, listen to me. It’s way farther than it looks. I barely made it.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Kid, I was scaling the great pyramid of Giza when you were still climbing the rails of your crib.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Ok…
[Sally trying to jump but fails.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Sully! Sully!!! Sully! Are you alright!? Talk to me! Don't worry! I'm coming!

Speaker: Sully
Text: It’s ok! I'm alright!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Alright, don’t move! I’m on my way down. Dammit, Sully, what are you trying to prove?

Speaker: Sully
Text: What’d I tell ya? Piece of cake.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: You scared the crap outta me.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah, well, you should’a seen it from my angle. Uh, uh… watch the leg.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Is it busted?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Oh, maybe. But that’s not what hurts… Oh, jeezus. At least that’s not all that hurts. Give me a hand.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Alright… you know, a fall like that would’ve killed a lesser man.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah… well… back in the day…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: …yeah… you would have made the jump with your eyes closed. I know. C’mon, let’s find Chase and get the hell out of here.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Old man’s hurt… take him out.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Of course these assholes had to show up.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Just stay back, I'll handle this.

Speaker: Sully
Text: I'm not an invalid, you know!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I was wondering…

Speaker: Sully
Text: They don't stand a chance against us!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Really? Us?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Stay close, Nate! We showed ‘em!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah. We did. C'mon. Snake temple’s gotta be that way.

Speaker: Sully
Text: I’m coming just as fast as I can.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Sully, what’d you say those choppers were?

Speaker: Sully
Text: YH-1 Cherokees. Standard cavalry for the U. S. -of- A since 1952.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: And how many men they can carry?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Eight to ten… Twelve if they’re traveling light.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: So three of them running all day… Dante could have entire army out here.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah… easy.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Great.
[Nate finds a chopper in the jungle.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Look… their staging ground.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Yeah…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Alright, Temple of the Serpents is up the mountain… you ready?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Whoah, whoah, whoah… hold up, kid.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: What’s wrong?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Nothing’s wrong, but with this bum leg, there's no way I’m climbing up there. I’ll just hold you up.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: You’re not going to hold me up.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Hey, Nate, hear me out. Once you get Chase, we’re gonna need a ride outta here, right? I mean, I don’t know about you, but there’s no way I’m hiking anyplace after this…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Wow… yeah, I hadn’t thought of that.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Well, you get going. You find her. I’ll wait here and the first chance I get I’m stealin’ one of those…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: You think you’re up for that?

Speaker: Sully
Text: Heh, I might be little rusty but… yeah I think so. You know when I was in the Navy, I used to… yeah, yeah… another story, another time. Go on, get outta here.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Ok. I’ll be back.

Speaker: Sully
Text: All right. Hey, Nate? You be careful out there. Remember my retirement plan.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Hey, I’m not the one who busted up his leg.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Hey, it’s just a bad sprain. I’m feeling better every minute.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Right.

Speaker: Sully
Text: Alright. Good luck, kid. I’ll see ya’…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: …on the other side. We've been over this.

Speaker: Sully
Text: But with the girl, right? She better be worth all this.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: That’s what I said.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Dante, everything’s clear up to site two.

Speaker: Dante
Text: Then why do I keep hearing gunfire?

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: There’s still some resistance at site three, on the other side of the temple complex. And I’ve got reports of fighting by the river.

Speaker: Dante
Text: Drake.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Sir?

Speaker: Dante
Text: Never mind. Dante out.
[After the fight we return to the scene from the beginning of the game.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Dante…

Speaker: Dante
Text: I got a report that shots were fired by the river.

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: It was nothing.

Speaker: Dante
Text: I'm telling you it was Drake. You can tell your men to up their game or there's going to be a lot less of them around come payday.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: …son of a bitch. I'll see you in hell.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: No, no, no, no.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Drake’s been spotted, in the upper chamber. Kill him on sight. Dante’s orders.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: One of Dante's mercenaries… Bastards…
[Nathan makes his way through the ruins eliminating mercenaries. When he trying to get to the other side, he spotted by s mercenary with RPG.]

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: I got him! You're a dead man! See how you like this!
[The mercenary shoots at Nathan and he falls… but manage to cling to the ledge. After long fight he go to the entrance of the temple.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Whoa… Why do I suddenly feel like Jonah stepping into the mouth of the whale? No wonder Marcos thought this was the gateway to hell.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Dante…

Speaker: Dante
Text: Get that bridge raised… I want those bastards trapped in here like rats.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Guerro’s men are falling back. It’s a complete rout.

Speaker: Dante
Text: Good. What 'are you doing standing here yapping about it? Get down there… Wait. You have them save Guerro for me, you got it? I owe that son of a bitch a little payback.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Sure boss, whatever you say.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Ah, goddamn it smells like shit in here.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Sure it wasn’t you?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Keep moving…

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: How does he do that. I can’t get a bead on him.

Speaker: Dante
Text: Did you get that lower bridge raised? If any of Guerro's men get past you there's gonna be hell to pay.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: We’re on it.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Up I go. Careful now. Where are these guys comin’ from?  …don't wanna cut myself.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Kill him on sight. Dante’s orders.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: He’s moving too fast.

Speaker: Guerro
Text: Where are your men?

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: It’s a slaughter…

Speaker: Guerro
Text: Get ahold of yourself.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: They have guns…

Speaker: Guerro
Text: Soldado! Escuchame! Rally the men. Get them to the cavern of bridges. There we will make our final stand, eh? Bierta! We are so close! Don’t you see? With so much gold…. the revolution will live!

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: The girl is not cooperating.

Speaker: Guerro
Text: I will deal with her later. Come… we are not finished yet.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Tell Guerro to go to hell!

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: It’s Drake. Get him. Stop him at the bridge.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: The female target's been found.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: In the lower passage, in the doorway chamber.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Chase!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Stop! You don’t have any idea what you’re doing!

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Shut her up!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: These are support columns. If you blow them up, the entire cavern comes down on our heads! We all die!

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: I said, shut her up!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Ok, line, you know what? Just give me enough time to get out of here, OK?

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Stop or I’ll shoot.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Shoot her!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: ‘Shoot her, shoot her’… Do you know how tired I am of hearing you guys say that? You wanna shoot me? Go right ahead… Set that timer, and we’re all dead anyway.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Alto!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Hey! Assholes!
[Nate kill all the mercenaries and reunites with Marisa.]

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Nate!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Hey. It’s okay.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Thank God! I thought Guerro killed you!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Not for the lack of trying. Did he hurt you?

Speaker: Marisa
Text: No, no. I heard gunfire a couple hours ago, but uh, Guerro disappeared.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: That was Dante keeping him busy.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Dante? Here?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yep, with a small army. C’mon, we leave now, we can get out of here while they’re busy killing each other.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: No! No, I’m not leaving.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: What?

Speaker: Marisa
Text: You gotta see this. C’mere. We are so close… look. This is what Marcos was writing about. He called it the Doorway of the Gods. See? The symbol of the sun, the seven rays of morning…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah… Chase!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: …illuminating the pantheon of the gods… just think about how terrified he must have been… challenging everything that he knew…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Alright… Chase!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: All I need to do is find one piece of evidence that proves that… that Marcos was here.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Marisa! You have to listen to me.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: I told you… don’t call me that. I know what you’re going to say. You’re gonna stay this isn’t worth my life, right? But it is, Nate, it is. This is the chance of a lifetime. And I am not just going to walk away and give it all up to Guerro.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Wait.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: And I’m sure as hell not going to give it to Dante.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Let me see that.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Why do you keep doing that? Would you… Would you just listen to me?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I am listening… I’m just not paying attention.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Arrgh!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Chase, your grandfather had the key to Quivira the whole time.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: What?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Watch…

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Oh my God, it’s a key.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: It’s a combination lock actually See the… the rings? They move… The lock must activate a mechanism inside the door. All we have to do now is find the right combination.
[Nate opens the lock.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Back up! Back up!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Whoa. Whoa!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: We did it.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: This door hasn’t been opened in over four centuries.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Wow… Hey, hold up.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: What’s wrong?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: There is a good chance we're not coming back this way, so let's take everything we need with us. (he picks up Marisa’s backpack) Alright. Hey listen, if we’re gonna do this, we need to move fast, alright?

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Ok.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Here, we might need this.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: C’mon. Let’s go this way.
[After a bit of exploring Nate finds a body.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Look, over here.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Quivirans!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Or what’s left of them. They’ve been here for centuries…

Speaker: Marisa
Text: But they’re so well preserved… their bodies are all contorted… like they died in agony.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Maybe, maybe birth defects of some kind? Maybe sacrificed to the gods of the underworld?

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Imagine what poor Friar Marcos must have thought when he stumbled across them?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: There’s still no proof that Marcos actually made this far. C’mon, let’s keep moving.
[A little further ahead…]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Whoah, the Lake of Ghosts.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: It’s like ice in here.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: This is all glacier melt. So swimming’s probably not a good idea.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Yeah, unless we want to freeze to death. Woah. (she sees giant statue carved in a cave wall]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Hey, check it out. Over here.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Wow. I think they went a little crazy with the whole Temple of the Serpents thing, huh?  You think it’ll float?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah, it seems sound enough, but I guess we’ll find out. Here, help me push it into the water. Ready?

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Okay.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Let’s do it. One more.
[They sit on a boat and set sail.]

Speaker: Marisa
Text: When I was a kid my grandfather used to take me all over the world on his artifact hunts. We took a boat not much bigger than this all the way from Para Brazil to La Paz in Bolivia. Now that was quite a journey. That’s Atchihuatli, god of lakes and drowning.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: So if you're in a canoe a mile beneath the earth, you wanna stay on his good side?

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Probably a good idea.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: So… you were raised by your grandfather, huh? How'd that happen?

Speaker: Marisa
Text: …Not much of a story. Both my parents were killed when I was a little kid.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Really?

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Yeah, I know, rough, right? But it was a long time ago. Evidently there was a break in… they were both shot. I don't remember much about it.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Uh… Chase… I’m sorry.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: It's okay. So how about you? From what Dante told me, you had it rougher than I did.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: …lake's not big enough for me to tell my story.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: A Sete Cidades emblem.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Friar Marcos must have left it here, fearing that evil spirits, devils, had claimed the souls of the dead civilization. He would have believed it had the power to ward off evil.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Probably. But there's no way to prove it was his. Let's keep rowing. We have to find the throne room.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: So, what are we looking for again?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: As if you don't know… c'mon.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Oh, you’re just testing me. Okay, the throne chamber is beneath the visage of Itzicaltli, the god of death. He rules the underworld. If we find him? We find the chamber.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Nice.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: According to my grandfather, in Quiviran mythology this place is called the Tears of Chihopotex. She was this place is called the Tears of Chihopotex. She was separated from Mahuaquiotex when the world was made and cried for a thousand years, her tears filling the second level of Mitzican. Because she was the goddess of childbirth, she cursed child-bearing women to an eternity of pain.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Heh. Now you're lecturing.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: No I'm not. But since you asked.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Nope. I didn't.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: The chamber we’re looking for contains the Throne of Gold, the center of Mitzican, the lowest level of the Quiviran underworld.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Guarded by the four aspects of Teochicatol. I read his journal too you know.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Oh yeah.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: And… who's this?

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Huezicaltli, the god of disease, pain, plague and insanity. One of Itzicaltli's servants.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Ah, such a cheerful pantheon of gods.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Yeah, no kidding.
[They mooring.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Huh… the pattern on this floor looks familiar… But the mosaic is all scrambled… You say they're embracing here? Looks to me like they're at each other's throats.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Well, they were married for a million years or so.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Ooh… that’d do it.
[Nate assembles the floor tiles.]

Speaker: Marisa
Text: You did it again. Boy, doors within doors within doors. Whatever’s in here… the Quiviran’s wanted to protect it pretty badly.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah. Let’s find out why.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: There’s a sconce. Man, I wish I’d remembered to bring a lighter.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Oh… wait, I have one. Wait while I light this.
[They enter the room with gigantic gold veins on the walls and the golden city beneath.]

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Wow, look at the walls.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: The Golden Abyss.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: The what?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: It’s something that Marcos wrote in his report to the Sete Cidades… ‘and there, below the throne of the Morning Star, great veins of gold coursed through the walls as blood from the Beast of Mammon, a golden abyss to guard the gate to hell…’

Speaker: Marisa
Text: How do you remember all this stuff?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I have perfect recall…

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Really?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah… and a good journal.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Uh huh, c’mon. C'mon, slowpoke. Come on up here. I hope this lighter holds out.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I thought only old guys who smoked cigars carried lighters…

Speaker: Marisa
Text: What’s that?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Uh--Never mind.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Wow, I thought I’d seen everything. This is amazing. The Throne of Gold.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: We made it.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Yeah. Come on. Oh my God, Nate. Look at his clothes.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Moorish. 16th century.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Esteban! It’s gotta be. But how is he so well preserved?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I have no idea. I tell you one thing. He didn’t stay behind willingly.
[He trying to pulls out a dagger from dead man’s chest.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Let's get serious.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Careful!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Really?  16th century. Spanish.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: I don’t get it. You don’t think…?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: We’ll know in a second.
[Nate cleans up the dagger and notices a symbol of Sete Cidades.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Here’s your proof. This could have only have belonged to one man.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Friar Marcos. He murdered Esteban.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: No. Remember what you said at the massacre site? Not murdered, sacrificed. Esteban was a Sete Cidades offering. Blood sacrifice to seal the gates of hell.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: My grandfather was right all along. This is going to rewrite history.
[They hear an explosion.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: The Doorway of the Gods… Bastards set off the explosives.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Can’t be… this entire place would be coming down.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Either way, it doesn’t give us much time. Just grab what you can and let’s get the hell out of here.
[Suddenly Marisa hear some strange noise…]

Speaker: Marisa
Text: What is that?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Step away!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: It was in Guerro’s pack. I must have accidentally switched it on.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: It’s a Geiger counter… What would Guerro be doing with a Geiger counter? The tailing area from the strip mine… near the Spanish gravesite. There must be uranium deposits throughout these mountains.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Oh my god. The gold…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: It’s radioactive. All of it.
[Dante comes up to them from behind, clapping his hands.]

Speaker: Dante
Text: Nice. Nice. Someone give Mr. Rhodes Scholar here a prize for figuring out the obvious.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: How did you get here? We took the only boat.

Speaker: Dante
Text: Same way I always beat you Drake… by being smarter than you. I’ll take that… (he takes Drake’s gun) Hey babe. I’d take your gun too, but we all know, you don’t carry one, huh. Wait a minute… what’s this? Our little rose has grown a thorn? (he takes the dagger from Marisa]

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Give that back!

Speaker: Dante
Text: Oh, this is important to you? Huh? Well, it’s very, very nice. (he throw it away]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Chase, don’t.

Speaker: Dante
Text: You kids have found all kinds of swell toys, ain’t ya?  Hello gorgeous, I wondered where you were.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Wait, you knew all along.

Speaker: Dante
Text: What, about the gold being hot? Sure. El Generale figured it out by accident when he had Chase’s amulet. Who cares. Click, click, click, click, click, click, click, click. Here it is. Here it is! It’s kinda like music, isn’t it? Huh?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: And you’re just gonna take it anyway.

Speaker: Dante
Text: Oh, you sound so surprised.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: You can’t do that. Once this gets into the world market… jewelry, coins, dental work…

Speaker: Dante
Text: Come on, what’re a few rads among friends? Right?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Use your head, think of the radiation poisoning… millions could die.

Speaker: Dante
Text: Don’t be so melodramatic, Drake. Huh? It’s just low grade, nothing worse than an x-ray or two, huh? Can you feel it? Besides, this? This little thing? It’s just gonna end up in a museum… Besides, who goes to museums anyway except for old people, right? Who’s it gonna hurt, really?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah… wonder if that’s what they thought.

Speaker: Dante
Text: Maybe we should ask ‘em. Hey, did you hate living with all this beautiful gold? Huh? Let’s take a moment and cry for all the poor Quivirans - ‘boo hoo.’ Sucks to be them. Come on, it took like a century or two, and they lived with this stuff. I’m gonna have this and they lived with this stuff. I’m gonna have this littered throughout the black market before you can say, ‘Hey, have you had that mole checked?’…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Wise ass, right to the end.
[Nate grabs Dante’s gun and kills a mercenary. The fight with Dante begins.]

Speaker: Dante
Text: C'mon buddy… Show me what you got.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: That the best you got?

Speaker: Dante
Text: I'm gonna kill you.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Hah! Nice try!

Speaker: Dante
Text: Piece of shit. Son of a bitch. I'm gonna kill you. How's that feel, huh? You like that rock taste good? C’mon Drake!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Didn't your mother ever tell you not to run with a knife? Huh?
[Nate takes Dante's knife and puts it to his throat.]

Speaker: Dante
Text: Do it.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Get up. We’re leaving.

Speaker: Dante
Text: Nice. Nice. We coulda been partners, Drake. The two of us all this gold? This coulda been ours.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: You know what? Keep it. Gold is yours. But when get to that Doorway of the Gods, I’m setting off Guerro’s explosives and I’m sealing this cavern up for good.

Speaker: Dante
Text: No you ain't. You know why? Because you ain’t got it in you.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: We’ll see. Oh, there’s your princess. Oh, look out! She’s got a gun! She played us both, Drake… the whole time. Keeping her hands squeaky clean with her self righteous bullshit… letting me take out Guerro for her.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: You know what, not everyone thinks like you do, Dante. You’re the one that uses people, not me.

Speaker: Dante
Text: Oh sure. You stand there, watching the two of us tear each other’s throats out. And when we’re gone, who’s left with all the beautiful gold, huh?

Speaker: Marisa
Text: You’re pathetic.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Forget him. We’re leaving.

Speaker: Dante
Text: Good luck with that buddy. The only way outta here now? Is through an army of my men. You still want to go with her?

Speaker: Marisa
Text: The passage to the lake…

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Drake! Drake! You’re going all soft. It’s Sully’s fault. That’s why you always leave empty handed. Drake! Empty handed! Empty handed!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: More of Dante’s men. They must not know the war’s over. Alright, wait here.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Fat chance.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: You took Dante’s gun.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Yeah, like he said, need to start taking care of my own business.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Chase, listen to me. For some things… there’s no turning back.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Well, it’s too late to worry about that now, isn’t it? You ready?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah, okay, but stay behind me.

Speaker: Chapter 32
Text: “There’s No Turning Back”
[Nate and Marisa climbing and fighting an army of enemies.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Hey, come on.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: My hands are about to fall off.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Up there, on the ropes!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Not more ropes! Okay, I can do this.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Over there! Watch it!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Uh, remember when I said I wasn’t afraid of heights? I lied!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Climb, Chase, climb!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: I’m trying.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: To the side! To the side!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Hurry!
[Eventually they get to the Doorway of the Gods.]

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Here it is.
[Nate finds the remote to detonate all the bombs in the cave.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah. Okay, listen. Once I push this we haul ass, okay there’s no way to shut it off.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Come on. What’s the matter?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: He was right.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: What are you talking about?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I can’t do it.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Nate?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I can’t bury him alive.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: He just tried to kill you.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I know.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Quivira is poison Nate. It killed my grandfather. I’m not letting it kill anyone else. (she takes away the remote from Nate]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Chase, wait!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: I can’t. I’m sorry. (she pushes the button]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Ah crap! We gotta move.

Speaker: Chapter 33
Text: “Getting My Hands Dirty”
[Nate and Marisa run out the cave fighting mercenaries on the way.]

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Look out!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Careful. Oh… crap.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Here goes! The bridge is gone!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: We gotta keep moving!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Hey, I’m right behind you.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Oh, big jump!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Watch it! Wh… Which way now? Look out! Watch out! Oh no! We have to climb on that??

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Whoah, whoah, whoah… That was close!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Woah! Ah! Woah! Oh god! Okay.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Go! Just go!

Speaker: Marisa
Text: They've got me pinned down!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Alright, come here. We can reach that together.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: You said down was sometimes up… this looks like a while lotta down.
[The column they climbing begin to fall apart.]

Speaker: Marisa
Text: The column… It's collapsing. Nate, look out! Run!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Chase?! Chase!
[It lies on the ground, crushed by a fragment of a column.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Chase, come on, don’t give up on me now.

Speaker: Guerro
Text: Senor Drake. I’m so very pleased to see that you are well.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Guerro.

Speaker: Guerro
Text: There’s no need to mourn the seriorita. You will soon be joining her.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Come on, Guerro. Look around, can’t you see? …whole place is coming down.

Speaker: Guerro
Text: I see perfectly, I assure you. It is you that are blind. Do you see this, senor Drake? (he shoot at Nate with rocket launcher]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Ah… nice little upgrade from your toy sword. Did you get tired of cutting ropes?

Speaker: Guerro
Text: This? This is all that’s left of my army. The revolution is over. Tell me, senor Drake… what is a general without an army?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Oh, I don’t know… unemployed?

Speaker: Guerro
Text: He is nothing. I have but one cause left - I will die here today, but you, you will die with me.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Talk, talk, talk. Come on Guerro… stop feeling so sorry for yourself. So some jersey street punk kicked your ass. Not the first time you’ve lost, right? And you can always get a job beating up defenseless women… maybe some kids?

Speaker: Guerro
Text: Yes. You are so right. Enough talk.
[While Guerro tries to shoot Nate with rocket launcher, he climbs up the ruins trying to get to him.]

Speaker: Guerro
Text: Senor Drake…

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Woah, that was close!
[When he succeeds, the fateful fistfight begins.]

Speaker: Guerro
Text: Now, we are both trapped. Eh?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Stop this Guerro… we still have time…

Speaker: Guerro
Text: There is no honor in defeat, senor Drake, only in death.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Yeah? Let’s find out.

Speaker: Guerro
Text: Huh, Senor Drake?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: …damnit!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Come on, Guerro. No honor in defeat, remember?

Speaker: Guerro
Text: You know why that revolution of yours failed? ‘Es un cobarde’…

Speaker: Guerro
Text: A coward? Name calling… is that the best you can do?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: You’re just like the rest of those worthless thugs who served in that pathetic mob you call an army.
[Nate throws Guerro on a fragile bridge and it collapses. Guerro falls into the fiery abyss.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Now go find your honor… Hold on Chase.
[Nate runs to Marisa with all the strength left. He raises the fragment of column using a lever.]

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Chase! Chase! Oh, Come on! Damn it! You all right?

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Yeah. Alright… Oh God.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Alright, we’ll get you fixed up, don’t worry.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: This is so painful.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Alright, quit your bitchin’. (laughs]
[Next scene.]

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Oh no… it’s a dead end!

Speaker: Nathan
Text: No, there’s gotta be another way up.

Speaker: Marisa
Text: Well, can you climb it?

Speaker: Nathan
Text: I don’t see any handholds.

Speaker: Nathan
Text: Nate?!

Speaker: Nathan
